articleinfo.title: GT 6.0 Migrating Guide for C Common Libraries

article.simpara: The following provides available information about migrating from previous versions of the Globus Toolkit.

section.title: Migrating C Common Libraries from GT5.2
section.simpara: GT6 is API (source) and ABI (binary) compatible with GT 5.2. Dependency resolution for GT6 is done with pkg-config only, not pkg-config or GPT.

section.title: Migrating C Common Libraries from GT5.0
section.simpara: All components are compiled with a runtime configuration of thread model, instead of having to compile both threaded and nonthreaded build flavors. To enable threads for a program, set the environment variable GLOBUS_THREAD_MODEL or call globus_thread_set_model() with the desired thread model, such as pthread or windows.

section.title: Migrating C Common Libraries from GT4.2
section.simpara: No changes need to be made in applications using version 4.2.x releases of the C common libraries.

section.title: Migrating C Common Libraries from GT4.0
section.simpara: No changes need to be made in applications using version 4.0.x releases of the C common libraries.

section.title: Migrating C Common Libraries from GT3
section.simpara: No changes need to be made in applications using version 3.x releases of the C common libraries.

section.title: Migrating C Common Libraries from GT2
section.simpara: No changes need to be made in applications using version 2.x releases of the C common libraries.
